info.title: BlueXP Copy and sync API documentation
info.description:
Overview The NetApp BlueXP copy and sync service offers a simple, secure, and automated way to migrate your data to any location in the cloud or on your premises. The service enables you to convert and move data stored in any object store including NFS or SMB servers, Amazon Simple Storage Service (S3), Google Drive, Box, and more. When using this service, you can create a sync relationship to copy data from any source to any destination target.

The service exposes an associated REST API which you can programmatically use to administer the copy and sync API resources. There are eight categories of endpoints defined within the BlueXP copy and sync REST API:
  • Accounts
  • Messages
  • Data Brokers
  • Groups
  • Relationships
  • Storages
  • Reports
  • Timelines (deprecated)

See https://docs.netapp.com/us-en/bluexp-copy-sync/api-sync.html to get started with the BlueXP copy and sync API.

Note: Before using the API reference documentation, review the Get started section for the BlueXP APIs. For more information about the security tokens and identifiers you’ll need when using the API, review the Common workflows and tasks section.

REST implementation

HTTP methods

Method Description
POST Create a resource
GET Retrieve a resource instance or collection
PUT Update specific properties of an existing resource instance
DELETE Remove an existing resource

Request headers

Request Header Description
authorization Required. Contains a JWT token (user)
x-account-id Contains the tenancy account ID and can be included depending on the API call
username Contains the SMB or SFTP username when calling the APIs related to SMB
password Contains the SMB or SFTP password when calling the APIs related to SMB
domain Contains the SMB domain when calling the APIs related to SMB
access-key Contains an AWS access key when calling the APIs related to StorageGRID, IBM, or ONTAP S3
secret-key Contains an AWS access key when calling the APIs related to StorageGRID, IBM, or ONTAP S3
storage-account-connection-string Contains an Azure storage account connection string when calling the APIs related to Azure storage accounts
x-bucket-name Contains a bucket name when calling the AWS list S3 private links API
private-key Contains a Google Drive private key when calling the Google Drive APIs
client-email Contains a Google Drive client email when calling the Google Drive APIs
subject Contains a Google Drive subject when calling the Google Drive APIs
client-secret Contains a Box client secret when calling the Box APIs
public-key-id Contains a Box public key ID when calling the Box APIs
private-key Contains a Box private key ID when calling the Box APIs
passphrase Contains a Box passphrase ID when calling the Box APIs
x-netapp-external-request-id-src Contains an ID to use when accessing the external vault
x-netapp-external-request-id-trg Contains an ID to use when accessing the external vault

Query parameters

A list of all the possible query parameters available for each service component is provided in the table below. This is a summary by component, however not every query parameter can be used with each endpoint in a specific component. See the detailed descriptions of the individual API calls for more details.

Component Query Parameter
Accounts noCreate (optional)
target (required)
Messages last (optional)
Data Brokers host (required)
version(optional
path(optional)
isEFS(optional)
exportName(required)
accessPoint(optional)
bucket(required)
prefix(optional)
port(optional)
storageAccountName(required)
container(required)
region(required)
Groups host (required)
port(optional)
rootDirectory(required)
version (optional)
path (optional)
isEFS(optional)
exportName (required)
accessPoint (optional)
bucket (required)
prefix (optional)
port (required/optional)
storageAccountName (required)
container (required)
driveId (required)
folderId (optional or required)
folderName (optional)
clientId (required)
enterpriseId(required)
appName(optional)
region(required)
Relationships relationships (required)
Storages provider (optional)
Reports reports (required)

Response headers

This API uses the standard HTTP response headers common with all BlueXP APIs. See REST implementation for more information.

HTTP status codes

HTTP Status Code Description
200 OK: Returned for successful operation completion
400 Bad Request: Returned if the input is malformed and could not be parsed
401 Unauthorized: Returned if user authentication failed or the token has expired
403 Forbidden: Returned for authorization errors depending on the resource and token
404 Not Found: Returned if the requested resource could not be found
500 Processing Error: Returned if an error occurs on the server while processing the API call
Error handling The following processes are involved with error handling and processing:
  • The error is logged for supportability.
  • The error is also returned to the API caller on synchronous operations.
  • In case of asynchronous operations, the error will be returned on the GET /messages API.
cURL examples The following example retrieves relationships for a specific account:

curl -X GET https://api.cloudsync.netapp.com/api/relationships-v2 -H "accept: application/json" -H "authorization: <user_token>" -H "x-account-id:<account_id>"

The following example retrieves reports for a specific account:

curl -X GET https://api.cloudsync.netapp.com/api/accounts/<account_id>/reports -H "accept: application/json" -H "authorization: <user_token>"

get.description: Retrieves the tenancy accounts.

delete.description: Deletes the current account. </br> WARNING: This action will delete the current account from the copy and sync API.

get.description: Retrieves the account information.

parameters.name: noCreate
parameters.description: Don't create the requested account if it doesn't exist

accountId.description: The logged in account's tenancy ID

name.description: The logged in account's name as retrieved from the OAuth provider

noCharge.description: Indicates whether all the relationships are Cloud Volumes Service or Azure NetApp Files

daysLeftForTrial.description: Days left for a free trial or (-1) if the trial expires

subscriptionStatus.description: The account's AWS marketplace subscription status

put.description: Registers an account to a marketplace.

mpProvider.description: Customer subscription provider received from the marketplace

mpCustomerToken.description: Customer subscription token received from the marketplace

get.description: Retrieves the logged-in account's relationship status.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: Request for relationships with target Azure NetApp Files and source Cloud Volumes ONTAP stats

totalBytes.description: Total bytes copied according to requested flags

numberOfRelationships.description: Total number of relationships according to the requested flags

totalFiles.description: Total number of files copied according to requested flags

bytesCopiedInTheLast30Days.description: Array of bytes copied per day in the last 30 days

bytesCopied.description: Total bytes copied in a day

put.description: Adds the NetApp Support Site credentials.

get.description: Retrieves the NetApp Support Site credentials.
Retrieves a list of all licenses.
Retrieves the license settings.

freeTrial.description: If it is on free trial period

existingRelationships.description: The number of the existing relationships

chargedRelationships.description: The number of the charged relationships

delete.description: Deletes the NetApp Support Site credentials.

get.description: Retrieves the asynchronous messages. This API endpoint refers to a long polling endpoint for asynchronous messages.

clientId.description: The queue ID of the requesting client

get.description: Retrieves all the data brokers.

status.description: 'COMPLETE' for an online data broker or 'FAILED' otherwise. Only available after the data broker has contacted the service for the first time

message.description: The error message if the data broker has a 'FAILED' status

fileLink.description: The link to the Data Broker Cloud Formation template or installer

transferRate.description: The Data broker current transfer rate

lastPing.description: The last time the Data Broker services did contact this service (EPOCH TIME)

port.description: If this is a NetApp 'listener' Data Broker, this is the port that data broker listens on

encryptionType.description: Data Broker Encryption type - in case it is part of NFS encrypted relationship

vpcCidrBlock.description: Data Broker AWS VPC CIDR block

subnetCidrBlock.description: Data Broker AWS Subnet CIDR block

awsAccountId.description: AWS account ID in which the data broker was created

canUpdateNodeVersion.description: Indicates if advanced node version is compatible with this distribution

processMaxMem.description: Data Broker Maximum Memory for process

concurrency.description: How many tasks in parallel each transferrer process handles
How many tasks in parallel each transferrer process handles

encryptionType.description: Data Broker network location - if initiator is src, listener must be trg
Data Broker network location - if initiator is src, listener must be trg

objectTagging.description: Use S3 tagging to store object metadata

fileTypes.description: The file types that is included in the relationship

compareBy.description: The file attributes that should be compared

uid.description: uid ( relevant when source or target is file system )

gid.description: gid ( relevant when source or target is file system )

copyProperties.description: The object properties that should be copied

tags.description: copy tags ( cloud to cloud only S3 compatible )

excludeByRegex.description: Excluded files by regex (For example - "\.txt\." will exclude the files file.doc.txt.gz)

minSize.description: Minimum file size (in bytes). Only files of equal or larger size will be transferred by the relationship

maxSize.description: Maximum file size (in bytes). Only files of equal or smaller size will be transferred by the relationship

minDate.description: Data broker will sync files that were last modified after this date. The date must be an ISO 8601 valid date. For example - '2012-02-21'

maxDate.description: Data broker will sync files that were last modified before this date. Insert 'null' to sync all future files. The date must be an ISO 8601 valid date

minCreationDate.description: Data broker will sync files that were created after this date. The date must be an ISO 8601 valid date. For example - '2012-02-21'

maxCreationDate.description: Data broker will sync files that were created before this date. Insert 'null' to sync all future files. The date must be an ISO 8601 valid date

nextTime.description: The first time the relationship should run

done.description: Should send notification about DONE status

failed.description: Should send notification about FAILED status

aborted.description: Should send notification about ABORTED status

running_continuously.description: Should send notification about RUNNING_CONTINUOUSLY status

syncType.description: field for UI - to indicate if we copy only acl or copy also data

type.description: Relationship phase - Initial copy or sync

timeEstimation.description: Time estimation until the end of the sync

step.description: Sync step that failed - TRANSFER or SCAN

connectorId.description: Connector Id ( for data sense query )

dataBrokerId.description: Data Broker Id - this is deprecated - please use `groupId` instead

objectTagging.description: Use S3 tagging to store object metadata

fileTypes.description: The file types that is included in the relationship

compareBy.description: The file attributes that should be compared

uid.description: uid ( relevant when source or target is file system )

gid.description: gid ( relevant when source or target is file system )

copyProperties.description: The object properties that should be copied

tags.description: copy tags ( cloud to cloud only S3 compatible )

excludeByRegex.description: Excluded files by regex (For example - "\.txt\." will exclude the files file.doc.txt.gz)

minSize.description: Minimum file size (in bytes). Only files of equal or larger size will be transferred by the relationship

maxSize.description: Maximum file size (in bytes). Only files of equal or smaller size will be transferred by the relationship

minDate.description: Data broker will sync files that were last modified after this date. The date must be an ISO 8601 valid date. For example - '2012-02-21'

maxDate.description: Data broker will sync files that were last modified before this date. Insert 'null' to sync all future files. The date must be an ISO 8601 valid date

minCreationDate.description: Data broker will sync files that were created after this date. The date must be an ISO 8601 valid date. For example - '2012-02-21'

maxCreationDate.description: Data broker will sync files that were created before this date. Insert 'null' to sync all future files. The date must be an ISO 8601 valid date

nextTime.description: The first time the relationship should run

done.description: Should send notification about DONE status

failed.description: Should send notification about FAILED status

aborted.description: Should send notification about ABORTED status

running_continuously.description: Should send notification about RUNNING_CONTINUOUSLY status

syncType.description: field for UI - to indicate if we copy only acl or copy also data

type.description: Relationship phase - Initial copy or sync

timeEstimation.description: Time estimation until the end of the sync

step.description: Sync step that failed - TRANSFER or SCAN

connectorId.description: Connector Id ( for data sense query )

put.description: Updates the settings for a relationship.

get.description: Retrives timelines.

tags.name: Accounts
tags.description:
Overview The accounts endpoints provide information about the identity of the user's tenancy account. The endpoints enable you to receive information about licensing (PAYGO or CONTRACT subscriptions from Microsoft Azure), AWS marketplace, or bring your own license (BYOL from NetApp) and perform licensing-related operations. The following actions can be performed with the accounts endpoints:
  • Retrieve account statistics information
  • Add a BYOL license
  • Retrieve a list of NetApp Support Site credentials associated with an account
  • Retrieve license information of an account
  • Update subscription information (using the /register API call)

tags.name: Data Brokers
tags.description:
Overview The data brokers endpoints provide information about the data brokers in an account and enable you to perform various operations on the data brokers. The following actions can be performed with the data brokers endpoints:
  • Retrieve data broker information (including type, group ID, address, operating system, node version, VPC, Vnet, and more)
  • Delete a data broker
  • Restart a data broker
  • Modify a data broker's proxy configuration
  • Move a data broker between groups
  • Retrieve data broker's local configuration

There are a few deprecated API calls to use a data broker to retrieve information from the customer network utilizing the network permissions, such as retrieve S3 buckets, retrieve CIFS shares, and more. The deprecated operations are as follows:

  • Retrieve S3 buckets
  • Retrieve CIFS shares
  • Retrieve NFS exports
  • Retrieve Azure containers
  • Retrieve NFS export folders
  • Retrieve CIFS share folders
  • Retrieve S3 bucket folders
  • Retrieve StorageGRID buckets
  • Retrieve StorageGRID bucket folders
  • Retrieve IBM buckets
  • Retrieve IBM bucket folders
  • Retrieve ONTAP S3 buckets
  • Retrieve ONTAP S3 bucket folders
  • Retrieve KMS keys
  • Retrieve S3 private endpoints
  • Retrieve Google buckets
  • Retrieve Google bucket folders

tags.name: Groups
tags.description:
Overview The groups endpoints provide information about the data broker groups in an account and enable you to manage the groups. The following actions can be performed with the data broker groups endpoints:
  • Retrieve data broker group information (information on the group configuration and each data broker in the group)
  • Download data broker group logs (download logs from each data broker in the group)
  • Change the data broker group configuration - control the number of processes and concurrency in the data brokers
  • Delete a data broker group
  • Use the data broker group to perform various asynchronous operations such as:
    • Retrieve S3 buckets
    • Retrieve NFS exports
    • Retrieve SMB shares
    • Retrieve SFTP directories
    • Retrieve AWS KMS keys
    • Retrieve StorageGRID buckets
    • Retrieve IBM buckets
    • Retrieve ONTAP S3 buckets
    • Retrieve Azure storage account containers
    • Retrieve Google drives
    • Retrieve S3 private links

tags.name: Messages
tags.description:
Overview The messages endpoint sends user information, received by performing asynchronous operations, such as listing an S3 bucket, listing shares, and listing exports, to a client.

The API call process involves the following steps:

  1. Execute the API endpoint initially without using the “last” query parameter. The API response will include an ID field value.
  2. Subsequently, execute the API endpoint using the ID field value obtained after performing Step 1.

tags.name: Relationships
tags.description:
Overview The relationships endpoints provide information about the sync relationships between source and target destinations in an account and enable you to perform various operations to manage the sync relationships. The following actions can be performed with the relationships endpoints:
  • Retrieve sync relationship information (including statistics)
  • Create a sync relationship
  • Delete a sync relationship
  • Change sync relationship settings
  • Start a new sync on a relationship
  • Abort a sync operation
  • Update the relationship endpoint credentials
  • Update relationship tags
  • Retrieve the identifier of the sync relationship (without all other properties)

tags.name: Reports
tags.description:
Overview The report endpoints enable you to view reports of a BlueXP account such as the number of directories and files in an account, the distribution of file size, the depth and breadth of the directories, and more. You can also create or delete a report by using the report endpoints. The following actions can be performed with the report endpoints:
  • Retrieve reports (including statistics of an account)
  • Create a report
  • Delete a report
  • Abort a report

tags.name: Storages
tags.description:
Overview The storages endpoints provide information about the different source and target locations. This API category displays only the endpoints that are part of a sync relationship in an account.

You can retrieve the following information by using the storages API endpoints:

  • NFS host IP addresses
  • SMB host IP addresses
  • Azure storage accounts
  • SFTP host IP addresses
  • IBM host IP addresses
  • StorageGRID host IP addresses
  • Azure NetApp Files IP addresses
  • Cloud Volumes ONTAP, on-premises, Amazon FSx Data LIF IP addresses
  • ONTAP S3 endpoint IP addresses
  • Amazon Elastic File System IP addresses
  • Box app names
  • Google Drive subjects

tags.name: Timelines
tags.description: Overview The timelines endpoints provide information about historic operations in an account (for example, create a relationship, sync relationships, and abort a relationship). The timelines API endpoints are deprecated; use the BlueXP Audit service API to view your historic account-related operations.
